Understanding Citizenship.title: What is Citizenship?
content: Citizenship is the status of being a recognized member of a state or nation.
A citizen enjoys rights such as voting, freedom of speech, and protection under the law.
Citizens also have responsibilities such as obeying laws, paying taxes, and participating in civic duties.
Understanding Citizenship.summary: Citizenship is both a privilege and a duty that links individuals to their government.

Democracy and Participation.title: Democracy and Participation
content: Democracy is a system of government where power lies with the people.
Participation in democratic processes includes voting, attending public meetings, and community engagement.
Informed citizens help ensure government accountability and transparency.
Democracy and Participation.summary: Active participation makes democracy strong and representative.

The Constitution.title: The Constitution and Rule of Law
content: The Constitution is the supreme law of the land and outlines the structure of government.
It protects fundamental rights and freedoms of citizens.
Rule of law ensures no one is above the law, including leaders.
The Constitution.summary: The Constitution ensures justice, equality, and protection for all citizens.

Governance and Leadership.title: Governance and Leadership
content: Governance involves the processes and institutions through which decisions are made and implemented.
Good leadership includes integrity, accountability, transparency, and service.
Citizens should evaluate leaders not by tribe, wealth, or fame but by service to the people.
Governance and Leadership.summary: Strong governance and ethical leadership drive national development.

Rights and Responsibilities.title: Rights and Responsibilities of Citizens
content: Rights include freedom of expression, religion, movement, and access to justice.
Responsibilities include respecting others' rights, protecting the environment, and paying taxes.
Balancing rights and responsibilities is key to peaceful coexistence.
Rights and Responsibilities.summary: Enjoy your rights while fulfilling your responsibilities as a citizen.

Devolution and County Government.title: Devolution and County Government
content: Devolution is the transfer of power and resources from the national government to counties.
Counties manage local services like health, agriculture, trade, and infrastructure.
Citizens can participate in planning and budget-making at the county level.
Devolution and County Government.summary: Devolution brings government closer to the people for better service delivery.

National Values.title: National Values and Principles
content: Kenya's Constitution outlines values like patriotism, social justice, human dignity, and integrity.
These guide public officers and all citizens in conduct and decision-making.
Living these values builds unity and progress.
National Values.summary: National values are the moral compass of a united and just society.
